item.title: Large area of road is breaking up making the road unsafe for cars and cyclists especially., 18th April
item.description:
Road from the last house in Coberley heading west before the junction to Close Farm and Cowley. Road below allotments. Entire carriageway is becoming impassable and dangerous. Accentuated by the village having a school and children being at risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Street, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large broken up areas at road junction, 18th April
item.description:
Junction has broken up in the middle causing drivers leaving Cheltenham to move over to the middle and indeed opposite carriageway to avoid the holes which is extremely dangerous. Large area needs completely resurfacing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Signals at on Kings ditch lane are out of time, 18th April
item.description:
Temporary signals on kingsditch lane, that are outside Arnold Laver and McDonald's are absolutely out of time. Can't miss them because it's causing queues all the way back to Swindon Village, up Wymans Lane, at 7am. This will/has gridlock the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Entire road surface is breaking up, 18th April
item.description:
On the bridge section of the Cirencester road adjacent to Lidl entrance the whole road is starting to break up from numerous repairs that are now failing. As this is a bridge maybe it needs compete resurfacing. Incredibly dangerous for cyclists which use this road for the new cycle lane of Charlton Hill
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole getting bigger daily, 18th April
item.description:
Next to central bollard when entering the 30mph zone near LilleyBrook Gold Course. Drivers and cyclists have to move to the centre of the road to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Road patch failing, 17th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Hewlett Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham

item.title: Sequencing of green light out of nine elms road, 17th April
item.description:
The sequencing of the light is currently incoherent. In the morning during school run times the queue out of nine elms road is massive. Most cars are turning right into Cheltenham road. Most of the green light phase is used up by cars coming out of greyhound gardens opposite, often allowing only two or three cars to come out of nine elms. Only occasionally the light is green longer on the nine elms side which improves the flow of traffic. Most often though it takes 10 min and more of queuing to get out of this road, especially at 8 in the morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 inch pothole in middle of Moorend road, 17th April
item.description:
This pothole has been there for ages and been reported several times but not been fixed. This is a very busy road with lots of traffic and many people cross the road at this junction as there is no pedestrian crossing so it is unsafe and an elderly person may trip over

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
